name: Stillingia
Relationship: Compare: STAPHIS.; MERC.; SYPHIL.; AUR.; CORYDALIS (syphilitic nodes).

Respiratory: Hoarseness and chronic laryngeal affections of public speakers
Larynx constricted, with stinging in fauces
Urine: Deposits white sediment; urine milky and thick
Skin: Scrofuloderma; syphilis, secondary eruption and later stitches
Burning, itching of legs; worse, exposure to air
Ulcers; chronic eruptions on hands and fingers
Extremities: Aching pains in bones of extremities and back

details: Chronic periosteal rheumatism, syphilitic and scrofulous affections. Respiratory symptoms well marked. Torpor of lymphatics; torpid liver, with jaundice and constipation.
